result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Joseph Alex Pimental appeared by video.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. appeared by video for Joseph Alex Pimental.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 04 to follow defendant's other case 20CF1598 scheduled for final pretrial and jury trial. Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am. Status conference scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Alex Pimentel in court.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Joseph Alex Pimentel.  Attorney Chad Wozniak for Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. Case tagging along with other felony case. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Alex Pimentel in court.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Joseph Alex Pimentel.  Attorney Chad Wozniak for Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. Case tagging along with defendant's other felony case set for trial. Case adjourned in Branch 4.

Defendant Joseph Alex Pimentel in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Case to tag along with defendant's other felony. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Alex Pimentel in court, appear by video with attorney Frederick F Klimetz, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Alex Pimentel in court with Attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Klimentz is newly appointed and needs time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DM, AAS, CM, RM, and SM.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joseph Alex Pimentel in court with attorney David Thomas Conley.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
